title: Build R38/CUDA13-compatible containers for Jetson Thor
description:
The dustynv R36 containers have CUDA 12.x PyTorch binaries which fail with Error 801 on R38/CUDA 13.

Options:
1. Use jetson-containers to build locally:
   - cd ~/jetson-containers
   - Set default-runtime nvidia in /etc/docker/daemon.json
   - Build: jetson-containers build comfyui audiocraft cosmos kokoro

2. Check for updated containers:
   - Monitor dustynv Docker Hub for R38 tags
   - Check jetson-containers repo issues/releases

3. Alternative approaches:
   - Try NGC containers for Jetson
   - Check if any containers support CPU-only mode
   - Use CUDA forward-compatibility layer if available

notes:
## Progress
Images pulled successfully:
- dustynv/comfyui:r36.4.3 (13.9GB)
- dustynv/audiocraft:r36.3.0 (15.1GB)
- dustynv/cosmos:r36.4.3-cu128-24.04 (13.8GB)
- dustynv/kokoro-tts:fastapi-r36.4.0-cu128-24.04 (11.6GB)

## BLOCKER: CUDA 13 Incompatibility
Host system: L4T R38.4.0 / JetPack 7.4 / CUDA 13.0 / Driver 580.00
Containers: Built for R36.x / CUDA 12.8

All containers fail with:
```
RuntimeError: Unexpected error from cudaGetDeviceCount(). 
Error 801: operation not supported
```

This is a fundamental CUDA forward-compatibility issue - PyTorch binaries compiled for CUDA 12.x cannot initialize on CUDA 13.0 drivers.

## Workarounds to Try
1. Build containers locally using jetson-containers for R38
2. Wait for dustynv to release R38-compatible containers
3. Check if containers can run CPU-only mode (slow)
